intro: Henckelia bifolia, commonly known as the two-leaved henckelia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine conditions. Its leaves are opposite and usually have a distinct, lance-shaped appearance. Henckelia bifolia is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its delicate, blue or purple floral displays.
